title: @Meddler What direction will you be taking Shen in his upcoming revamp?
body:
Will he still be a tank or will he be more of a tanky-fighter like Irelia? Any leaks or teasers youd like to share with us?Will he come with a Lore update as well like Poppy,Irelia (and probably Taric).

Im just really interested because shen was one of the first Tank champions that I played and really liked.

replies.body: The plan is to keep Shen as a tank, though we'll be trying to find ways to have that make at least a little more sense thematically (so potentially a bit more evasion instead of just soaking/shielding damage).

>Evasion.

Im a bit hyped. Im really hoping he is going to have cool little animations where he dodges or reflects it with his swords. By the way while updating Shen are you going to change any of his animations? is he still going to walk like he crapped his pants?
Shen will be a gameplay update, with some visual adjustments to support that. We won't be doing a full visual update or audio update for him at this time though.

Sounds great, with that in mind. Shen is my main and having his identity still be there with some more nimbleness for a fight is something im hoping for. I know you guys are probably far along with him but i have had some ideas for him too. Hopefully they're somewhat inline/reasonable.

His **W** could stay a shield(_smaller_ or _larger_) just lasting 1 second as if youre anticipating a hit. and upon successful timing _ie. shield pops_ you get an additional shield(_small_ or _large_) for a few seconds and a refund in energy.

His **E** could be the same initial _taunt _  but give it like a Renekton treatment(hitting a target allows you to do another dash), except, hitting an initial target or targets(+1 each maybe?) gives you more(_tauntless_/_dmgless_) dashes either each taking energy or replacing the current energy refund scale. 

Or instead maybe a short _stealth_ 1st parter and the single current dash 2nd parter.

His **Q** could do what it does now but maybe adds an _AoE_ that grants its _life tap_ effect? And if you hit the target actually marked by  **Q** with Ki Strike it would immediately _heal_ you instead of overtime, for that hit.

or instead divide the damage up through multi part casts so you can mark multiple different targets to help your allies and yourself heal. 

And the **passive** and **ult** can stay largely the same. Full energy upon **ult** cast would be cool. I think this makes Shen feel the same and yet more like a ninja.

Anyway, im sure Shen will turn out Fine, great hopefully, but these were some ideas i had come up with for some time now. Take care!
Someone probably already asked this, but will he still be viable as a support after the update?

**Shen **
Unpopular opinion here but i don't really like the idea of making Shen more Ninja. Forcing  him into being more evasive to me just feel like you are making him more one dimension. 

Shen is more then a ninja or a sneaky sneaky ninja he is Shen. What is Shen you may ask. Let me tell you, Shen is they type of guy who can take a hit. His lore made him out to be a guy who can endure because his trial or test was to watch his father being torture and not even blink or get emotional about it. 

_Now I have faith that Riot would make Shen cool but all I'm saying is don't let the reason for his change is to make him more ninja-y and one dimensional_

Also I would also like to talk about Swain because he is similar to Shen but also an Inverse of Shen. Shen is a ninja but doesn't play like one where Swain is a Tactician who doesn't play like one. 

**Swain**

For me the Swain we currently have is fitting a lot of people want him to be more tactical like he plan a head but I don't think that is what he should be. To me the Swain we have is the other side of the Master Tactician. This side is the side that is just chilin in his oval office one some assassin sneak up on him an BOOM bird the word. This Swain although does not show the Master tactician side of Swain but it show the Bird man side which is equally part of Swain. 

**Conclusion **

All I'm saying is that the champions are **multi-dimensional **and they can be look at from different angles. Also any Naruto fan out there would know that Shinobi mean to endure which would make sense with Shen thematic and it would knock out two bird with one stone. Shen or should I say Shenobi are meant to endure by making him more of this type to endure you are making him more ninja-like and Shen-like at the same time.

please, try to keep him viable as a support ;_;

I started loving him in that position because i can roam like hell and stand united to my carry when needed. I know you probably won' t change the ult or the dash ( if nothing changed from a post of a while ago) but i am still worried :c

If I may ask. What kind of Ap build do you play on Shen? I play Shen a lot and I'm always interested in new ways to play/ build him.

Inb4 sion update.
"We felt shen wasn't in touch with what we wanted him to be, so we turned him into a ninja assassin."

Why does shen even need a revamp? He has high damage with health scaling everything and a low cooldown aoe taunt for CC.  I foresee % max health damage with some true damage icing somewhere on top of that mess that will become another broken champ.
Because having a strong or effective kit isnt the same as having a healthy kit with thematic cohesion.

hybrid shen is now good with {{item:3124}} and {{item:3146}} together.  I'd go more with {{item:3748}} if you play him bruiser hp stacking offtank. What makes him so good is his utility, so you play him however you want. 

I just didn't like full tank shen because he falls off hard outside of passive damage. Even then, you'd have to build him as an hp tank which was countered by {{item:3153}}(which every adc and their mother built.)  Shen did poorly as a damage soaker because his shield scaled poorly with tank builds and tank stats were subpar in general for him. That and they nerfed his e's width, so you had to hit it perfectly at the tip for some champs, since he'd just fly over them ala shyvana ult whiffs. I lost plenty of games on either of them because of that. 

Now that {{item:3075}} scales with armor, you lose out on dmg if you stack hp runes, so you'd be better off building him like a Juggernaut than just straight tank {{item:3742}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3748}}. Unless you are a support and just stacking resists then {{item:3075}} would be better.

His Q is largely uninteractive, and definitely could be made more interesting. His W is just boring. And his passive is really strong with the way it interacts with Grasping Hands (and now that we have Grasping Hands, his passive is largely unnecessary for him to tank). So we could scrap that for something that makes him more tanky and less fighter-y.

His passive never was there to let him tank, it was there to encourage stacking health so that you ACTUALLY do something when your dash and ult are on cooldown. It also restores energy making it VERY necessary for his kit.
